boardgame.name: Fiasco, USA
boardgame.description:
An all-American pair of playsets designed to evoke the essence of this great nation -- whether your are desperately trying to feed the 24-hour news cycle or fighting your homeowners association tooth and nail of the color of your aluminum siding...

News Channel Six by Ken Coble, Tom Gurganus, and Chris Norwood.
News Channel Six is in last place in the local ratings , and things are looking grim. Will you find a breaking story, or is it time to make a little news yeurself?

Home Invasion by Jason Morningstar
Poppleton Terrace was such a nice neighborhood with good property values, but that's all changing now. What exactly is going on with the weird lights in that house across the street?

boardgame.name: Teen Angst
boardgame.description:
What's more fun than high school? Many things including summer camp, but Fiasco High is a special place full of bad decisions and worse athletes, while Camp Death is, well, Camp Death. Not everyone is going to make it home alive from either.

Fiasco High by Jason Morningstart
High school, the best years of your life. Four years of learning and grown or maybe four years of debauchery and mayhem. Will you rise to greatness, or punch greatness right in the dick?

Camp Death by James Gabrielsen
Camp Clearwater's been abandoned since some grisly, unsolved murders 30 years ago. Now you're here to re-open it. What could go wrong? This playset includes special rules with four alternate Outcomes that help you identify the killer among you.

boardgame.name: Unknown Monsters
boardgame.description:
Wedding planners and mysterious beast hunters have a lot in common -- the stakes are high and one wrong turn spells disaster, usually at the hands of a hideous man-ape that smells like a skunk and flips cars for fun. Combined, a Sucker Creek wedding is going to be one for the ages!

Regina's Wedding by Jason Morningstar
Wedding bells are ringing! Regina is finally tying the knot and the wedding is going to be a real event. Of course everyone has an agenda, and even the happiest occason can become a social - and literal - battlefield.

Beast of Sucker Creek by Jason Morningstar
For hundreds of years, reports of blood-chilling cries in the night and occasional sightings of the Beast have been a fixture of local gossip. Is it a hoax? A crazed bear? Something strange and wholly new to science?

boardgame.name: Feel the Rush
boardgame.description:
A dirtbag's a dirtbag, whether she is selling pills out of a restaurant kitchen or doing crimes to afford a set of GSC Stage 2 cams for her 2006 Subaru street racer. What happens when desperation meets opportunity? When we have to Go Real Fast but lack the skill and focus to keep all the wheels on the road -- or the dishes on the tray -- who is going to pay the price? Probably not the dirtbag responsible.

In the Weeds by Steve Segedy
Whether you're a waiter, a line cook, or an aspiring manager, it's a greasy hustle that never earns enough money, and even less respect. But even if the stakes are low, the ambitions -- and the staff -- are often stupidly high.

The Hasty and the Hateful by Jason Morningstar
We race for the same reason we breathe -- it is life. What we do isn't legal, but we answer to the god of the stoplight and the nitrous injection. We race. W go fast. We do crimes. We are family.

boardgame.name: Build-A-Fiasco
boardgame.description:
Back of the Box

This expansion includes two blank playset decks.

Make your own disaster! Level up your Fiasco experience by authoring your own custom cards! This expansion include two blank decks, everything you need to customize your favorite playset or to build your own glorious Fiasco from the ground up! Add a little local color, tune it up to your particularly questionable taste, or create something entirely new.

In each deck you find a complete set of pre-labled, Fiasco-standard Relationship, Need, Object, and Location cards, all waiting for your best ideas!

Fiasco straight out of the box is fun, but a Fiasco Playset you write yourself -- or in collaboration with your local gang of rascals -- is something else entirely.

boardgame.name: War Hounds
boardgame.description:
A new century has dawned for all pups and dogs on the great island continent of Doggerland. But the hope of a shining new future has quickly darkened. The nations of Doggerland fortify their borders, mobilize troops and artillery daily. Though many fear war, many more welcome it as the opportunity for glory and patriotic display. Little do they understand what destruction is to come…

Each player in War Hounds is the leader of a nation of dogs. There are 12 factions (6 double sided playerboards.) Each faction with its own set of abilities, functions, costs etc. Players will play over the course of 4 years, the war ending at the close of the 4th year. Players will play in rondel turn order, each round the turn order possibly changing. Players will take one action on their turn by selecting an action in the top of their playerboard. As with everything in this era of Doggerland history, things are hierarchical, meaning a chain of command or top-down, and so in selecting actions, generally a player may not select an action above those they have already selected. Players will draft troops, build artillery, invest in new technologies, influence new policies, shift and transform their economies, and of course engage in embroiled bouts of combat. Players will conquer territories, gain medals and lose casualties. Ultimately, the winner is the nation with the most victory paws at the end of the game.

The winner is the nation with the most total victory paws at the end of the game (all paws are awarded at game end--none during). Players gain victory paws from the following sources: medals, casualties (negative paws), controlled territories, technologies, policies, loan debt (negative paws) and wealth (1 victory paw per $25).

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Flames of War: Waffen SS Starter Force – Waffen SS Panther Kampfgruppe
boardgame.description:
The Waffen-SS were the elite combat arm of Adolf Hitler’s personal bodyguard.
Fighting wherever the fire was hottest, they had proved their mettle many times in the cauldron of battle on the Eastern Front.

With the American and British forces poised to invade Normandy, they were brought west to France to rebuild, tripling their strength to become far stronger than the handful of regular Army Panzer divisions facing the Allies.
When the Allies landed on D-Day, the SS were sent in to throw them back into the sea.

In the battles that followed, their unswerving determination and stubborn refusal to retreat made them the most feared opponents the Allies faced.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

boardgame.name: Flames of War: D-Day – Waffen-SS Forces in Normandy, 1944
boardgame.description:
This book gives you everything you need to begin building your D-Day: Waffen-SS force.

Between mid 1943 and mid 1944, the German focus was on the Eastern Front. After the failure of the German Kursk Offensive, the Red Army went on the offensive, throwing hammer blow after hammer blow to drive the Germans back to the Russian border. The elite 1st and 2nd SS Panzer Divisions were rushed to wherever the Soviets broke through, counterattacking to seal the breach. By Christmas, the divisions were worn out, barely a regimental sized battlegroup remained. They desperately needed to be withdrawn to France to rebuild back to full strength.

Then, as 1944 began, the Red Army attacked again. The two new divisions being formed in France, the 9th and 10th SS Panzer Divisions were rushed to the Eastern Front and the plans to rebuild the existing divisions were shelved. Finally, in March, the Spring rains turned the roads to mud and the Soviet offensives ground to a halt. All four divisions were returned to France for rebuilding, joining the 12th SS Panzer Division which was part way through its training. Six weeks into their training, still trying to bring large numbers of conscripted replacements up to scratch, the Allies invaded France on D-Day. Ready or not, the SS panzer divisions were rushed to the invasion front, counterattacking to drive the Allies back into the sea.

With a solid core of veteran leaders under your command, can your willing, but inexperienced troops defeat the Allies despite their massive superiority in numbers? Can you win a never-ending battle of attrition, or do you attack into the teeth of massed artillery, naval bombardments and airpower? Can you defeat the invasion and save your homeland?

Forces details on:

Tiger SS Tank Company
Panther SS Tank Company
Panzer IV SS Tank Company
StuG SS Tank Company
SS Panzergrenadier Company
SS Reconnaissance Company Company
Support


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

boardgame.name: Flames of War: Iron Cross – German Forces on the Eastern Front 1942-43
boardgame.description:
Iron Cross is the next step for the German army in Mid-War as we look towards the Eastern Front.

German players will be able to field familiar favourites such as the Panzer III and Panzer IV tanks whilst Iron Cross also introduces Grenadiers and Assault Pioneers allowing you to recreate the intense infantry fights of Stalingrad and beyond.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

boardgame.name: 1, 2, 3 Trésor à bâbord
Cifras piratas
Getallenpiraten
Number Pirates
I pirati dei numeri
Zahlen-Piraten
boardgame.description:
A children's game that has components for several different games that focus on the number 1 through 10.

1) Number Duel - similar to the traditional game of war except if the same number is flipped over by both players, both cards go to the discard pile. When all cards have been taken whoever has the most cards wins.

2) Die Counting - similar to Shut the Box. A player rolls the die and turns over a card matching that number or may roll again to try and turn over the 7, 8, 9, or 10. If the player pushes their luck and the sum is over 10, the play forfeits that turn. First player to flip over all 10 of their cards win.

3) Pirate Destinations - Another push your luck game of flipping over a card from the deck of cards (1 thru 10) and moving a pirate the number of spaces equal to the number of the card. The player who got to 10 (or closest to it) wins.

4) Quick at Calculating - Addition/subtraction math problem cards are used (the result will be a number 1 to 10). The player calculates the answer and then plays the card from their hand. If they are right, they keep the card, otherwise the card is discarded. The player with the most cards when the deck of problem cards is depleted is the winner.

boardgame.description: Ten years have passed since the Lightbringers drove back the hordes of the Darkness and sealed the Portal from whence they came. The heroes thought their job done, but the newfound peace was never meant to last. Dangerous new Portals have suddenly opened up all across the land. The Darkness and its hordes are flooding through, stronger than ever. It will not be enough to simply close the Portals this time. The Lightbringers must travel through them into the unknown to destroy the Darkness once and for all. Either Light will triumph, or the Darkness will consume every being in the world. This is where players find themselves in Massive Darkness 2, a new edition of the hit dungeon-crawler game.

boardgame.name: School of Talent: SUZU-ROUTE
boardgame.description:
User Summary

You attend Mikage Academy - the school of Talents; where students possess special powers bordering to magic. As a part of the bottom the Black Roses (a pack of slackers and rejects), you are in love with the White Lilies (the school's elite)'s dorm leader, Yuki Suzu.

boardgame.name: City of Gears: Creator's Compound Promo Tile
boardgame.description:
Originally available from TWIST Gaming Year 4 Kickstarter campaign.

Promo tile for City of Gears.

City tile, Industrial Community tile.
Link Bonus: 1 Zap token.
Activation cost: 1 Worker, 1 Zap.
Score: 3 Prestiges.
Gain 2 Prestiges for each Industrial Community (grey) tile your workers occupy, including this one.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: City of Gears

boardgame.name: Wetlands
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This ninth in the series deals with Wetlands. It discusses the effects of thick mud, swamp gas, diseases and parasites, swarms of insects, rot, and all the things associated with one of the most uncomfortable environs imaginable.

Now, instead of simply traveling to a tomb of horrors, the DM can have it in the middle of an expansive bog, with clouds of biting flies and noxious gases. Instead of stopping at the local apothacary, the characters are forced to search a hundred miles of stinking marsh for a rare alchemical ingredient that's needed to save the life of the king's son.

Also included diseases, parasites, a new character background, new equipment, a new language, a terrifying new creature, and random encounters.

boardgame.name: Odysseys & Overlords Advanced Tools
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book was written for Players and Game Masters as a supplement to the core rules of Odysseys and Overlords Player’s Guide. Material presented in this book is to help Players and Game Masters build on the foundations already created for the world of Odysseys and Overlords with advanced rules for classes, new equipment, additional spells and optional rules for gameplay.

Odysseys & Overlords Advanced Tools contains:

Setting details and a list of the gods for use with Odysseys & Overlords
Advanced options for six playable Genera: Abyss-kissed, Centaur, Human, Orc, Spellscorched, and Wild folk
Advanced options for six playable classes: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Fighter, Magic-User and Thief
16 spells, including cantrips and orisons
Languages for use in the world of Odysseys & Overlords

boardgame.name: Subclasses of the Planes
boardgame.description:
12 Exciting and Flavorful New Planar Subclasses for Heroes in the Forgotten Realms

Heroes in the Forgotten Realms encounter foes from many planes of existence. Indeed, some heroes even venture beyond the material plane in their quests. A special few heroes, however, carry the influence of the planes with them on their journeys, regardless of their destination. These heroes embody a particular plane, drawing power and unique abilities from the plane with which they have a connection. Whether you visit other planes or not, these subclasses can provide a rich diversity of options for players and DMs alike!

Featured subclasses:

Barbarian Path of the Beastlands: Take on an aspect of a predatory beast when you rage, bestial senses, tusks, scales, claws, or fangs. At higher levels, these aspects strengthen and become permanent. At 14th level, you can even polymorph into a large predatory beast.

Bard College of Pandemonium: These bards play a mad piping song that conjures the howling winds of their distant plane, whipping across the battlefield to scour their foes. You can also inflict visions of Agathion upon their foes or plummet them into shivering darkness.

Cleric Harmony Domain (Arcadia): Harmony clerics benefit from disicplined minds and emanate a harmonious influence, granting a bonus to their allies' saving throws. At high levels, you can even calm the emotions of a foe as a reaction when it makes an attack.

Druid Circle of the Arboreal: Arborea infuses these druids with the power to stand strong like a tree and to speak to plants at will. At higher levels, you are natural friends of all plant creatures and can even call upon the shrubs and trees around you, awakening them for a short time to aid you in battle.

Fighter Conquest Archetype (Acheron): The conquest fighter channels the combat zeal of Acheron, charging foes as a bonus action and granting a bonus d4 of tactical insight to their allies. At higher levels, you can call on your allies to use their reactions to make extra attacks, as well as use your own reaction to counterattack foes who strike you.

Monk Way of Chaos (Limbo): The chaos monk channels the ebb and flow of Limbo. Whenever you spend Ki, you may spend 2 extra to tap the randomness of that plane, granting you a variable benefit. It might refresh your Ki, or grant you advantage on your next attack, or even allow an addtional attack as a reaction. At higher levels, you can spend Ki to cast spells that warp others' perceptions of reality, from greater invisibility and mirage arcane.

Paladin Oath of Ysgard: The Ysgard paladins call upon the spirits of heroes who dwell on Ysgard. You can summon a valkyrie who harries your foes. You emanate an aura of endurance, granting your nearby allies temporary hit points, and can even welcome a glorious death, gaining free attacks against foes who hit you with a critical hit.

Ranger Feywilder: Feywild Rangers can cast the find familiar spell and can choose unique fey familiars: a blink dog, boggle, or sprite. At higher levels, you gain boons from the seelie and unseelie courts, endowing you with fey resistance to magic, among other mysterious powers.

Rogue Ethereal Marauder: The ethereal maruader can step into the border ethereal and reappear in a nearby location, using this ability to suprise foes or pass through solid objects. At higher levels, you can misty step as part of your Cunning Action, taking an attack with advantage when you arrive.

The Great Machine Sorcerous Origin (Mechanus): The machine sorcerous origin connects the sorcerer to the great plane of Mechanus. You have an affinity with machines and can summon a modron to assist you. At high levels, you can tranform your very flesh into a machine!

Warlock Elemental Patron: The elemental warlock gains an affinity with either earth, air, fire, or water, gaining approrpaite spells and damage resistances. You can add damage from your preferred element to your attacks. At high levels, you can even polymorph into an elemental.

Astral Wizard: Astral wizards can call upon the swirling mists of the Astral to cloak yourself or to stun your enemies. As you would on the astral, you no longer need food or drink, nor do you age. At high levels, you can even easily visit that arcane plane.

- taken from product page on DriveThruRPG

boardgame.name: Mythological Magic Items
boardgame.description:
Thirty Magic Items from Ancient Greek Mythology

Perfect for Any Mythic Game, Including Theros!

As featured in such classics as Clash of the Titans, Jason and the Argonauts, and The Odyssey!

Includes the following, and more:

The Aegis of Zeus, a mighty shield that hurls thunderbolts;

Aeolus’ Bag of Gales, a bag that contains an endless gust of wind;

Archimedes' Mirror, which can project a burning sunbeam;

Circe's Staff, with which she transforms men into beasts;

Dragon Teeth, which, when planted in the soil, cause soldiers to spring up and fight for you;

Eris' Apple of Discord, which, when thrown amidst your enemies, causes them to attack one another;

The Girdle of Aphrodite, which endows its wearer with the ability to charm and enthrall;

The Golden Fleece, which grants its wielder dominion over all who view them;

Hades' Bident of the Underworld and his Helmet of Invisibility;

The Harpe, or shortsword, of Perseus, with which he decapitated the Medusa;

The Hat of Hermes, which grants it wearer unparalleled speed;

The Lantern of Diogenes, which reveals truth;

Pandora's Box, which brings both a curse and a blessing to those who open it;

The Ring of Gyges, which grants invisibility but curses its wielder with selfish desire;

The Thread of Ariadne, which you can use to find your way through even the most challenging of labyrinths;

The Wings of Icarus, which grants it wearer the ability to fly, yet leaves them vulnerable to fire and heat;

Artemis' Longbow, Odysseus' Bow, Pan's Flute, Ambrosia, Panacea, the Shortbow of Eros, Hephaestus's Smithing Tools, the

Thrysus of Dionysus, the Trident of Poseidon, and more!

Includes a bonus monster from the gates of hell!

Taken from product page on DriveThruRPG

boardgame.name: Ship Simulator Extremes Fishing Trawler "Sigita"
Ship Simulator Extremes: Sigita Pack
boardgame.description:
Contains the "Sigita" Fishing Trawler and 6 missions

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: 101 Ioun Stones
boardgame.description:
101 Ioun Stones expands classical options for one of the most classic magic items in D&D. The options are split up into the following categories, and have a variety of rarity:
- Abjuration and Defense: including the ability to intercept incoming attacks.

- Divination and Language: including the ability to read other's emotions.

- Enchantment and Control Effects: including the ability to become immune to the charmed and frightened condition.

- Evocation, Damage, and Elemental effects: Including the ability to deal damage to anyone that hits you.

- Healing, Conditions, and Death Prevention: Including healing from an extra level of exhaustion.

-Illusion Effects: Including shooting a beam of light!

-Movement and Modifier Bonuses: Including the ablity to have spider climb.

- Perception and Tracking: Including the ability to have echolocation.

-Race-based stones: Stones for Genasi, Warforged, Tiefling, Aasimer, and more!

-Roleplaying and Misccellaneous: Including the ability to eat anything.

-Spellcasting and Spell Slots: Including the ability to capture caster's spells.

-Transmutation Effects: Including casting telekenesis at will.

From the product page on DriveThruRPG

boardgame.name: Ship Simulator Extremes: Ferry Pack
boardgame.description:
Experience the responsibility of a ferry captain as you take the rudder of different ferry types on some of the most popular routes in the world in this add-on pack for Ship Simulator Extremes. Whether it carries cars & cargo in its belly across the channel or is used as a municipal public transportation service, going on the ferry is always a bit of an adventure! Many of the world's capital cities have local ferry services, providing an indispensible and affordable link for its residents. The Ferry Pack brings 5 new ferries, a brand new player campaign with 10 missions, and new ferry specific gameplay features to Ship Simulator Extremes, adding many hours of gameplay for all virtual captains!

5 new Ferry types (Fast, Channel, River, etc.) available in Campaign, Free Roam and Multiplayer mode.
Ferry specific gameplay: Ferry ramp & door opening for loading/unloading, Directional switch for two-ender ferries, etc.
New Ferry player campaign featuring 10 missions all over the world.
Ferry mission functionality added to the Mission Editor, allowing for creation and sharing of Ferry specific missions.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Ship Simulator Extremes General Cargo Vessel "Winner"
Ship Simulator Extremes: Cargo Vessel
boardgame.description:
Take the helm of the vast general cargo freighter with the catchy name “Winner” as you embark on different missions hauling cargo between some of the biggest ports in the world. Cargo vessels are the mammoths of the seas, carrying millions of dollars in goods across the oceans. Maneuvering with a fortune in your cargo hold is a knowledge that comes with pressure. Skill and a cool nerve are required if you are to captain a vessel of this magnitude safely in and out of the harbor and across the ocean.

Brand new multi-purpose general cargo vessel
Added functionality to the Mission Editor, allowing for creation and sharing of specific cargo vessel missions
Three realistic cargo hauling & navigation missions: Captain your vessel through difficult weather & low visibility, use pilots and tugboats and make sure you arrive without compromising your cargo.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Ship Simulator Extremes Offshore Supply Vessel "Deniz Doga"
Ship Simulator Extremes: Offshore Vessel
boardgame.description:
The fast offshore supply & utility vessel “Deniz Doga” is a one of a kind vessel combining speed and agility with real working power. Take its helm and embark on missions supplying offshore platforms, investigating & marking specific diving areas and even using its rescue capability to tackle emergency situations. The offshore industry is something special, and this vessel fits perfectly in the unique landscape of oil rigs, VLC Carriers and offshore supply vessels that Ship Simulator Extremes has to offer. Get on board and enter the offshore world…
Features:

Brand new fast offshore supply & utility vessel
Utility vessel includes a new rigid-hulled inflatable boat (RHIB) for use during specific missions
Added functionality to the Mission Editor, allowing for creation and sharing of specific offshore utility & supply missions
Includes realistic offshore missions offering a range of features: tackle an emergency on board a VLCC carrier, deliver supplies to an offshore rig, Pick up divers for area marking and investigation and even transport the ‘Doga’ on board a large container vessel.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Luxury Cruise Vessel “MS Oceana”
Ship Simulator Extremes Cruise Liner "MS Oceana"
Ship Simulator Extremes: Ocean Cruise Ship
boardgame.description:
A floating city is the perfect way to describe the beautiful and vast cruise vessel “MS Oceana”. Sailing the oceans, visiting idyllic locations and catering to every need – however small it may be - of its thousands of passengers 24/7 is the objective of the MS Oceana’s crew. The Oceana holds a deployable and player controllable tender ship, provides players with the single most extensive walkthrough of any Ship Simulator Extremes vessel and allows you to take a look into the passenger cabins to feel what life on board must be like. This DLC puts you at the helm of this impressive cruise vessel as you sail 4 extensive missions making sure your passengers have the time of their lives! Give your passengers and yourself an unforgettable experience on board this majestic vessel…

Brand new Cruise vessel using advanced azimuth and bowthruster controls
Cruise vessel includes a deployable tender ship, for use during specific missions
Added functionality to the Mission Editor, allowing for creation and sharing of specific cruise vessel missions
Includes 4 realistic cruise vessel and touristic missions
Full walkthrough available, explore the deck of the MS Oceana and take a look inside a passenger cabin on board

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Ship Simulator Extremes: Inland Shipping
boardgame.description:
Most inland ship captains prefer the confined river and its banks to the vastness of the open ocean. But make no mistake, by no means is the river an easy ride and concentration is key when hauling cargo on a busy river to its destination. Lack of focus or experience can prove disastrous for your precious vessel, its cargo and your reputation. This new Inland Vessels campaign will guide you through some of the challenges an inland vessel captain faces.

3 New vessels to captain, including a new Inland Shipping Vessel, Harbour Tug and Small Support Vessel.
Enhanced gameplay functionality, including 5 Controllable Barges
Six brand new realistic missions featuring different tasks an Inland Captain faces and including the new vessels.
Added Inland Vessels content & functionality to the Mission Editor, allowing for creation and sharing of specific Inland Shipping missions

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Mal kurz die Welt ändern
World Changers
월드 체인져스
boardgame.description:
Who would you take to another planet if Earth were no longer inhabitable? What if you could pick people from long bygone eras?

Turns out that you are the captain of an interstellar spaceship, and you need to assemble your crew to live on a new planet. You can recruit them from historical persons throughout the whole of human history, but each person has their own peculiarities. Can you make the best team to let humanity thrive once more?

In World Changers, players draft cards from a common display with each card having an unique effect and a Legacy value. On their turn, players can either "invite" or "pass", with invite adding a card to the player's display, that is, a member of that player's team. Each card's effect is triggered either when the card is taken or when certain conditions are met. When no cards are left to invite or when each player passes in succession, the game ends and the player with the highest total Legacy of their members wins.

The game includes a booklet full of art and stories of the 32 historical persons featured in the game!

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Science and Seance Society
boardgame.description:
The Science and Seance Society is an asymmetric game for two players that plays in about 30 minutes.

You play members of The Science and Séance Society, a Victorian-era clandestine organization devoted to exploring the mysteries of reality. Each of you have chosen a completely unique method of dealing with a particularly nasty bit of chaos that has been summoned and vow to prove your methods are the best.

The player employing the mystic arts must manipulate a set of special double-faced tarot cards in hopes of arranging them correctly. Their goal is to arrange their cards in numeric (1/2/3/4/5) or alphabetical (A/B/C/D/E) order, from left to right. The very cards that they are arranging will also allow them to rotate, swap, and otherwise manipulate the order to their advantage. They win if they can properly align all of their cards before the Science player wins or their deck runs out.

The player committed to the scientific method must be meticulous in establishing order from chaos. They pull dice from a bag, roll them, and place them on engine cards, with specific dice needed for each. They win if they can complete all 5 of their engine cards before the Seance player wins or their dice are depleted.

It’s not always a genteel competition, however, as both players have options that allow them to slow down each other’s progress in this race to prove whose methodology is the most effective.

boardgame.description: Heading into the summer of 1986, this issue contains articles on the Celts, medieval weapons and armor, on Runequest, and a scenario

boardgame.name: Flames of War: Ghost Panzers – German Forces on the Eastern Front 1942-43
boardgame.description:
Ghost Panzers centres on the action around Operation Citadel, also known as the Battle of Kursk.

It was here in July 1943, that one of the war’s largest tank battles took place, with over 2450 German tanks and assault guns.

As the ground hardened after the muddy Russian Spring, the German army prepared to launch their Summer offensive, codenamed Operation Citadel. The target was Kursk, a city in the center of a huge bulge in the front line, where several Soviet armies could be cut off and destroyed.

To ensure success, new weapons were rushed to the front, including Ferdinand heavy tank-hunters and Panther medium tanks. These were combined with several panzer and panzergrenadier divisions, totaling an impressive 2,450 tanks and assault guns. Over 3,600 Soviet tanks were waiting for them, setting the scene for the largest tank battle on the Eastern Front...

Inside this book, you'll find:

• Background on the German Army in 1943, the Third Battle of Kharkov, and the great summer offensive at Kursk.

• Instructions on how to build a Panther Company, Mixed Panther Company, Armoured Panzergrenadier Company, Tiger Heavy Tank Company, and a StuG Assault Gun Company.

• A detailed painting guide.

—description from the publisher's website

If a player takes on too many Symptoms, that player will have to take a Test to see if he/she has contracted a virus! At the end of the game, players tally the points earned from their completed Deliveries and subtract any points from Deliveries still in their hand. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Flames of War: Afrika Korps – German Forces In The Desert 1942-43
boardgame.description:
The German Afrika Korps is a hard-fighting force of tough veteran troops who have won many battles and expect to win many more. Their Panzer III and Panzer IV tanks outclass the British tanks they face, and have been steadily upgraded to maintain their edge over the opposition. Their infantry are organized to have "few men, many weapons," so they pack a ferocious punch whether facing infantry or tanks. These are backed by the famous "88" dual-purpose anti-tank/anti-aircraft gun and the Stuka dive bomber.

Inside this book you'll find:
- Background on the German Afrika Korps and its part in the fall of Tobruk, the battle of Alam el Halfa, and the Battle of Medenine.
- Instruction on how to build a Panzer III Tank Company, Panzer IV Tank Company, or Africa Rifle Company.

—description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Santorini: New York
boardgame.description:
Santorini New York puts players in the work boots of builders constructing a grand city at the start of the 20th century. During the game, you will move your workers around Manhattan, raising buildings and skyscrapers. To prove your skill, climb atop the tallest building and look down over the city you have built. Only clever tactical moves and cards will bring you victory.

In this 2-5 player abstract strategy game, you'll control 2 workers while all building New York City. Each turn consists of a move and a build, but special Role Cards impact how you play your turn. Each player will have 5 Role Cards, choosing one to play at the beginning of each turn. Once used, it is discarded, which continues until each player only has 1 Role Card left. 4 more are dealt to each player to provide more options.

The first player to move to the third level wins the game, however they must have the Statue of Liberty when they do in order to win. Each Role Card has a number printed on it, showing it's initiative order. Role cards are simultaneously revealed each round, and the player with the lowest number goes first. The player with the highest number takes the Statue of Liberty, and is the only player who can win on that turn, creating an intense and dynamic 'all vs 1' environment every turn.

The game comes with 14 Role Card sets, but only 4 are used each game, providing a large amount of replayability. The game also comes with 6 custom sculpts of the world-record breaking skyscrapers at the turn of the century.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Tranquil Terror: Tiny Turtle Terrors
boardgame.description:
Expand the playable of Tranquil Terror with the mini expansion - Tiny Turtle Terrors. Play as a group of newly hatched sea turtles trying to survive.

Swimming against the current is challenging and tiring. In a situational flip, eat the jellyfish that get in your way to open a route. Be careful though, open water leaves the turtles visible to predators. Hungry sharks from below, and hunting birds from above, pose a constant threat to these hatchlings.

Every turn, swim against the current and try to survive long enough to get far out to sea. This cooperative game requires players to strategize in order to get 10 baby turtles safely on their way. Once they have all made it to the far side, you win.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Tranquil Terror

boardgame.name: Kamigakari: God Hunters
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Kamigakari: God Hunters is an action-packed Japanese RPG about everyday people imbued with shards of godhood. As dark gods encroach on our world, these innocents must become God Hunters and protect the thinning borders of the supernatural world! Will you become a magician and discover the Transcendent Promise? Will you defend your hometown with a heart full of burning justice and a jump-kick that pierces the heavens? Will you travel the world as a passing Godslayer, helping those you meet along the way? Or will your very soul burn away in the pursuit of power, transforming you into a new dark god? This world cries out for heroes! What kind will you be?

Fight Epic Supernatural Battles!

The enigmatic Mononoke and malevolent Aramitama await your challenge! Unravel their machinations in the real world, then enter the Spirit World for the final showdown!

Godly Power Deserves Godly Weapons!

With the Arms System, you can upgrade and customize your weapons endlessly! Turn that prop katana into a blade that rivals Masamune! Kit out your cell phone to cast earth-shattering spells! Or blast your enemies to bits with good old-fashioned firepower!

Control Your Roll!

Use the Dice Control System to save yourself from bad rolls, but use it sparingly! Do you want to leave a good impression when you ask out Hitomi-senpai? Or do you want to finish off an enemy with your ultimate attack?

boardgame.name: Sol 705
Sol705
boardgame.description:
Enjoy the first episode in this hilarious point and click free graphic adventure lead by a group of mysterious friends looking to break out from school and spend their free time at their own secret research club: Sol705.
This winter’s holiday is the last chance to save hometown from total bore – doom!
Break out from Father Carlito’s school, be part of bizarre investigations club devoted to reveal unclear paranormal phenomena!.
Try to uncover UFO sight cases and big infamous alien activity on the lost rural town of Laguna Tucana…
But more important, help the boys to face the toughest and exciting challenge of them all: making contact with those fabled creatures…classmates cheerleaders members of the local football team!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Le Gambit du Diable
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Écoute, mon fils, l'enseignement du maître, ouvre l'oreille de ton coeur ! Accepte volontiers les conseils d'un père qui t'aime et fais vraiment tout ce qu'il te dit.

User summary:

This scenario has a light tie-in with Supplément Maléfices n°12 : Danse Macabre

boardgame.name: Les Chasses du Comte Lassary
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Tout joueur de jeu de rôle est un honnête homme doublé d’un gentleman, c’est bien connu. Son esprit est vif, il a la repartie facile, le regard acéré et peu de détails échappent à son esprit, tant ses qualités d’observation et de déduction sont grandes.

C’est pour cela, cher Meneur de jeu, que mettre en scène et animer ce scénario va représenter pour vous un travail de titan… Hercule lui-même aurait certainement longuement hésité avant d’accepter d’accomplir une semblable tâche.

Mais je VOUS fais confiance, car, si les joueurs possèdent toutes les qualités évoquées ci-dessus, vous, oh vous !, vous en possédez d’aussi grandes...

Vos capacités de conteur, d’animateur, – que dis-je de magicien ! – sont sans pareilles et votre art de la persuasion fait que Machiavel et la famille Borgia au grand complet ne sont que des enfants de choeur à côté de vous.

Heureusement d’ailleurs que vous savez jouer de votre persuasion, car savez-vous ce que je vais vous demander ?

Oh non ! ne cherchez pas, vous ne trouveriez pas ! Je vais vous demander de mentir, mentir effrontément à chacun de vos joueurs, en lui faisant croire qu’il est le seul à être de connivence avec vous. Pourquoi cela ? “Tout simplement” pour les embarquer dans une histoire tordue qui va leur “péter au nez”...

User summary:

The 17-page PDF scenario is distributed with a RAR archive containing:


One JPG map file (full color, suitable for print-and-play)
Six PDF print-and-play handouts (17 total pages)
Six DOC print-and-play handouts (38 total pages)

boardgame.name: Spacelords
boardgame.description:
What is Spacelords?
Embark on an epic sci-fi, free-to-play adventure. Spacelords is a brand-new take on the shooter genre. Through its 4 vs 1 counter-operative campaign, you experience both sides of the story: Join the Raiders in their fight to free the legendary Broken Planet... or switch sides and fight as the Antagonist alongside the invading hordes!

The game
Does the world need yet another free to play shooter? This was the first question we asked ourselves when Spacelords was just an idea on a single piece of paper. Explore this section to find out what makes Spacelords an unique game!

The Story
An incredible discovery on one of Saturn’s moons leads a force of humans to a broken planet on the far reaches of the universe. A source of energy called Aleph exists there that grants ultimate power to whoever controls it.

The Antagonist
Sometimes the path of good and righteousness is not the path you want to follow. Sometimes being the bad guy is fun, right?! Being a Raider requires teaming up with other Raiders and working together for the greater good but what if you're not interested in the f***ing greater good?

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Feuerstern
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

A flaming star moves across the night sky of Alba and crashes over the forest of Escavalon as a fireball. People fear that the sign in the sky announces war and destruction or a great upheaval for the empire. Only a few who see the fire star suspect what it really is: dwarves from the Artross Mountains, elves from the Forest of Broceliande and a handful of Albanian magicians set out to find the impact site and to recover or protect the remains of value.
In the process, they will face competition from other adventurers, who will also have to solve the riddle of the Fire Star. The starting point for their search is the village of Bellslaed on the northern edge of the forest, where the companions are first confronted with a different problem: A heat wave in the Albanian spring is affecting people and animals and is getting worse every day.

The adventurers must unveil a secret whose origin lies in the magic of the dragons and decide whether or not to face what is happening in the hot forest and whether or not to hide the precious remains of the fire star. Conflicts with other seekers cannot be avoided.

The booklet contains a short adventure around an unnatural heat wave and dragon magic. It is suitable for adventurers of medium level.


Klappentext

Ein flammender Stern zieht über den Nachthimmel Albas und stürzt über dem Wald von Escavalon als Feuerball ab. Die Menschen fürchten, dass das Zeichen am Himmel Krieg und Zerstörung oder eine große Umwälzung für das Reich ankündigt. Nur wenige, die den Feuerstern sehen, ahnen, was er in Wahrheit ist: Zwerge aus dem Artross-Gebirge, Elfen aus dem Wald von Broceliande sowie eine Handvoll albischer Zauberkundige machen sich auf, die Aufschlagsstelle zu finden und die Überreste von Wert zu bergen oder zu schützen.
Dabei erwächst ihnen Konkurrenz in den Abenteurern, die ebenfalls das Rätsel des Feuersterns ergründen sollen. Der Ausgangspunkt für ihre Suche ist das Dorf Bellslaed am Nordrand des Waldes, wo die Gefährten erst einmal mit einem anderen Problem konfrontiert werden: Eine Hitzewelle im albischen Frühjahr setzt Mensch und Tier zu und wird von Tag zu Tag schlimmer.

Die Abenteurer müssen ein Geheimnis enthüllen, dessen Ursprung in der Magie der Drachen liegt, und entscheiden, ob sie den Vorgängen im heißen Wald entgegentreten oder nicht und ob sie die wertvollen Überreste des Feuersterns bergen oder verbergen. Konflikte mit anderen Suchern sind dabei nicht zu vermeiden.

Das Heft enthält ein kurzes Abenteuer um eine unnatürliche Hitzewelle und Drachenmagie. Es eignet sich für Abenteurer mittlerer Grade.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele

boardgame.name: カッパたん (Kappa tan)
boardgame.description:
カッパたん (Kappa tan) is a Japanese game with water.

In Japanese folklore, there is a Yokai called Kappa. Kappa is small humanoid that lives in rivers and waterways. The top of its head is formed like a crown or a dish, and the Kappa must keep water in it to stay healthy. If the Kappa spills or dries out, it suffers and dies.

In this game, the Kappa is an inverted paper cut with the base cut into the crown. Players take turns to add water to the crown using straws. A player dips the straw into a glass of water, puts their finger on the open end, and draws the straw out. Then they put the straw to the crown and release the water. The next player does the same and so forth.

Gradually the crown fills, until only surface tension is holding the water in. Eventually, a player adds enough water to break the surface and the water spills, and that player loses.

The crown design means that it takes a surprising amount of water to break. Players start taking up less and less water, and the other players mock their lack of nerve.

The game was originally hand-made and as well as a full sized Kappa, the game also has a mini Kappa for a quicker result. The game can be played by young children and adults alike.

In 2019, a professional version was made by itten, Kappa Bros!.
user summary

boardgame.description: Farmer Jones is similar to the well-known "memory", but requires even more concentration due to the acoustic announcement by the farmer from the included sound box, which animal or which item is currently being sought. Two to four children can support "Farmer Jones" with the search and keep the farm tidy.

boardgame.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 125 - Aug/Sep 2007)
boardgame.description: Issue 125

boardgame.name: Friends Wheel of Mayhem Game
boardgame.description:
Lets Play Wheel of Mayhem! Feel the confusion IRL and see why Chandler called it, "...the best game ever!" As featured on Friends, the game has all the original wacky instructions with trivia based on the show. This game tests you on your Friends trivia in ways you didn’t think were possible. Pick a Wicked Wango card? You might have to recite the Friends theme song from memory! Continue up the Ladder of Chance until you get to the Golden Mud Hut.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Noblecrumpet's Book of Gastromancy
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Welcome to the Foodgotten Realms, a fantasy setting that is entirely edible! Within this book lies the secrets of savory sorcery, scrumptious species, culinary classes, tasty treasures, and mouthwatering monsters.

boardgame.name: The Beermarket of Weirgarde
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Weirgarde is a quiet and unassuming town, a cozy refuge for skilled craftsmen and welcoming folk of all walks of life. Once a year, near autumn’s end, it hosts the marvelous Beermarket, a festival of drink, feasts, contests, and much rejoicing. Many a tale has started in these snow-covered lands, and even the most famed of adventurers can often remember their humble beginnings – winning a contest of bluffing with their friends, amidst the applause of the townsfolk, the cracking of the great bonfire, and the smell of fine dwarven beer.

boardgame.name: The Complete Hag
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Find out everything you need to know about hags and their darkest secrets

Hag's are complex immortal creatures of strange magic and dark rituals. To know them is to know victory!

boardgame.name: The Stray Cat
boardgame.description:
User Summary

VR game made by Eugene Lee, a student in Transmedia from Hong Kong Design Institute, about a stray cat that you meet one day; it is starving and really want to eat fish.

Protect it from harm as the locals throw stuff after it and other stray cats attack it.

boardgame.name: The Wizard's Cocktail Cabinet
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

If you wanted to drink responsibly, you've come to the wrong place...

Publisher's blurb:

Alcohol. Booze. That old devil hooch. We all indulge from time to time, and wizards are no exception.

The Wizard's Cocktail Cabinet offers 22 magical beverages and 4 new magic items to quench your thirst for adventure.

boardgame.name: Ettercap Lair: An Expanded Encounter Location
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

At the heart of a thick, haunted wood is the lair of the ettercap queen. Can the PCs cleanse the woods of her evil?

An encounter setting for level 3 PCs.

boardgame.name: You're in a Bar...
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You’re in a Bar… is a short, solo adventure designed for 1st level characters. Like many great adventures, it starts off--you guessed it! In a bar!

Written in a Choose Your Own Adventure style, this module is ideally suited for solo adventurers, though it can be easily adapted for a Dungeon Master and a party of one.

This module assumes you have access to resources provided by the Player’s Handbook, the Dungeon Master’s Guide, and Monster Manual. However, many of the stat blocks are provided.

You’re in a Bar… was created with the Forgotten Realms setting in mind, but is generic enough to fit in most fantasy environments.

boardgame.name: You're in a Bar... Heroes' Rest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You're in a bar...

Baron Myles Thorn's soldiers have been killed and his gold has been stolen. He wants you to investigate the matter and bring the perpetrator to justice. Your quest will take you to Heroes’ Rest, a cursed graveyard filled with incredible dangers. Journeying into an unexplored dungeon, you’ll discover a plot that goes beyond stolen gold…

“Heroes’ Rest” is a You’re in a Bar adventure for character levels 9-12.

boardgame.name: Ominous Crypt of the Blood Moss
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

A mad mage | A defiled crypt | A cosmic fungal entity
They say Ursodiol the Mad was the greatest mind to have ever breached the great Cosmic Void; that he looked beyond the myriad stars and the blackest depths of the hells into the swirling magical protoplasmic morass that is the beginning and end of everything. When they found his corpse, so hideously changed was it that it drove those who saw it to madness and despair. Fearful, they entombed him in the crypt of his forbears and sealed it tight. But little did they know that Ursodiol brought back something with him from his cosmic journey. And it is hungry...

Ominous Crypt of the Blood Moss is an old-school style adventure primarily designed for use with Old-School Essentials and other iterations of the Basic/Expert rules for the original fantasy roleplaying game.

A dungeon crawling adventure of cosmic horror for characters of 2nd to 4th level!

boardgame.name: You're in a Bar... Rooster's Mansion
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You're given a simple job--drop off the vial of celestial blood, get the payment, and leave. You weren't expecting to be drawn into a mystery. Rooms filled with sand and desert creatures complicate things. It might by best to just find the crazy wizard, Rooster Dycus, so you can deliver the blood and get out of the mansion. There couldn't possibly be anything world ending happening here, could there?

Rooster's Mansion is a solo adventure for character levels 1-4. Besides the main adventure there are also options for a quick side quest.

This module can be played individually or with a Dungeon Master and one player.

boardgame.name: Morthock's Magical Mundane Menagerie
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Delve into Morthock’s Magical Mundane Menagerie and discover common, everyday items that have been imbued with magical properties!

Morthock grew bored enchanting longswords and suits of plate, so he expanded his horizons toward typical adventuring gear. Within these pages, Morthock chronicles some of his favorite magical gear. Fulfilling his wish to make routine items more useful, you will find magical versions of scales, pitons, ball bearings, and over 40 other pieces of gear!

boardgame.name: Tome of Characters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Have you ever wanted to jump into an adventure but didn’t want to take the time to create a character? Or have you ever been running a campaign and find yourself in need of a quick NPC? Tome of Characters is what you need!

Tome of Characters contains 240 premade characters that can be used by players or as NPCs by Dungeon Masters. Each character class, levels 1-20, are represented.

How were ability scores generated? Ability scores were generated using the 4d6 method (with actual dice!). In instances where more than one score was below 10, the lowest score was rerolled.

Did you use feats? No, for the sake of consistency Ability Score Improvement was used instead of feats.

What races are represented? Humans are the only race represented in the initial offerings, though future supplements will include other races.

boardgame.name: Spells Outta Hell
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

YEEEEEAH!

Are you ready to rock!? This awesome supplement for your 5th Edition games of the World's Most Rockin' RPG will help you turn your boring and mediocore fantasy game into the most epic rock opera to ever grace your table. It'll take your bard from dud, to stud.

boardgame.name: Animal Upon Animal: Dinos
boardgame.description: Each turn in Animal Upon Animal: Dinosaurs, a player rolls the die, then places either one or two animals on the stack of animals, passes one of their animals to another player for them to place, or places an animal on the table, extending the base for other players to build upon. If any pieces fall off while you are building, you must take up to two of them back. The first player to have no animals in front of them wins.

boardgame.name: Piff Paff & Friends
boardgame.description:
You play with several tiles with the motifs of a total of twelve sea friends lying in front of you. The same pictures can be found on task cards, for which the same tiles must be found.

The electronic timer provides the necessary tension: A random bubbling sound sounds for ten to sixty seconds: During this time, cards can be played until the bugle interrupts the happy activity of the sea creatures. Whoever was on the turn loses this round

boardgame.name: Lama Express
boardgame.description:
The goal of the game is to complete a trip around the field and then be the first to bring your entire llama herd into your own home.

As nice and cozy as train travel can be, there are sometimes surprises for travelers. Some llamas, for example, forget to get out ... and so it goes on another round with the Lama-Express!

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: The Shrouded Grimoire - DCC Day 2020
boardgame.description:
Sanctum Secorum
DCC Day 2020
The Shrouded Grimoire

Publisher's blurb:

Compiling five years' worth of foreboding magicks and arcane lore, this libram contains 37 new spells and 13 new patrons to bring to your DCC RPG Table.

Alchemy, Chaos Magic, Fae Wizardry and so much more!
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Bewilderment and Panic in the Land of Faulty Tors
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A generative adventure for Hypertellurians.

boardgame.name: Dead City
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Dead City is the exciting and fast-paced introduction to the world of SINS, offering hours of thrilling survival-horror gameplay, with branching plotlines and evolving adversaries, taking the roles of five friends as they survive one apocalypse, only to be thrown into a desperate struggle to survive another.

Dead City is a 3 to 5 hour branching adventure intended for mature readers, and requires some previous gaming experience to run.

You will also need a pen, some paper, and around 10 6-sided dice.

boardgame.name: Waddle
boardgame.description:
Penguins are curious creatures. Flighty though flightless, they move about quickly towards things that appeal to them.

In Waddle, ever-curious penguins visit different places, sometimes in different neighborhoods. Each turn, you move the penguins around the city or bring some new ones in from out of town. Get the penguins to move into the patterns matching your cards to score points. The player with the most points at the end of a set number of rounds wins!

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: DM Handbook
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The DM Handbook addresses action resolution and monster creation.

boardgame.name: Player Rules
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The Player Rules cover time and movement, combat, level increase, and spell-casting. Character creation is also considered.

boardgame.name: Spells and Magic
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The Spells and Magic considers spell casting and magic items.

boardgame.name: Arms and Equipment
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The Arms and Equipment offers a list of available resources.

boardgame.name: Character Booklet
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The Character Booklet is a character-sheet with various game rules noted.

boardgame.name: Fizzleblimp's Sugarland
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This adventure takes place in the Forgotten Realms setting in the city of Waterdeep inside a massive factory known as Fizzleblimp's Sugarland which is ran by the eccentric, goblin Walton Fizzleblimp. Fizzleblimp is one of the most well known manufacturers of sweets across The Forgotten Realms but is also known for being slightly erratic and insane, with stories of him cooking people alive in the molten chocolate that flows like rivers throughout the factory.

Walton Fizzleblimp is one of the richest people in Waterdeep as well as The Forgotten Realms. He is prone to anger and is constantly paranoid someone is going to murder him for his estate and vast amounts of coin, so he's decided to hand out special invites to his candy factory which are hidden away in his best-selling chocolate bars the Xanathar Nougat in the form of golden tickets.

The catch? He plans on the people showing up to meet their end one by one in the hopes of squashing any potential plots for his murder. The hilarious part? Nobody in Waterdeep wants him dead because his candy brings joy to all.

The player's will be taking on the role of one of the winners of these golden tickets and will be brought on a tour of the factory which quickly turns into a battle of survival against Walton and his mad, candy creations.

boardgame.name: Into the Flames
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When an unexpected stellar flare damages the team’s colony, they must race against time to save it from total annihilation. Along they way, they’ll encounter mysterious communications, confront shadowy saboteurs and trek across the planet to obtain a rare and critical resource.

Shadows Over Sol: Into the Flames is an adventure supplement that revisits the exoplanet Siren, and serves as a companion or follow-up to the Siren’s Call campaign. It features an investigative horror scenario and is designed to run between two to four gaming sessions.

boardgame.name: Brindlewood Bay
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Brindlewood Bay is a roleplaying game about a group of elderly women — members of the local Murder Mavens mystery book club — who frequently find themselves investigating (and solving!) real-life murder mysteries. They become increasingly aware that there are supernatural forces that connect the cases they are working on and, in particular, a cult dedicated to the dark, monstrous aspect of the goddess Persephone will come to vex them.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Brindlewood Bay, le JDR sombre et cosy PDF

boardgame.name: A Murder Most Mucky
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

After the meeting, the Mavens are approached by Janet Flock, owner of the bookstore. Janet shows them a story in the local paper, about a Mucky Point lighthouse keeper, Cyrus Creel, who died after falling off the little walkway just outside the lighthouse’s lantern room. The article quotes several locals who think Mr. Creel was murdered, as the grizzled old lighthouse keeper had kept the lantern lit for decades and only someone green would lose their footing and tumble to their death. The paper also quotes the Mucky Point constable, Alvin Deschain, who says the death was strictly an accident and any talk of murder is baseless speculation.

boardgame.name: All Hallow's Scream
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Mavens are guests at a Halloween party being thrown at the fabulous Brindlewood Bay home of Abner Vidal, a retired filmmaker famous for gonzo, B-grade pictures. The first scene should be the Mavens being greeted by Abner at the front door. Abner is wearing a King Tut costume.

boardgame.name: Dad Overboard
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Just as their meeting is ending, the Mavens are approached by Brindlewood County’s chief law enforcement officer, Sheriff Wyman Dalrymple. He tells them that, several nights ago, a wealthy financier, Albert Krause, was dragged out of the bay, dead. Mr. Krause and his family were on a yachting vacation and their boat is presently anchored a quarter mile from shore. The surviving Krauses—wife Amanda, eldest daughter Sara, son David, and youngest daughter Emily—assert Mr. Krause was drunk and simply fell overboard. Sheriff Dalrymple suspects foul play but hasn’t been able to turn anything up. The body is currently being held in a cold storage at the fish market until it can be shipped back to Boston for the funeral.

boardgame.name: Jingle Bell Shock
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It’s the holiday season, and the Murder Mavens are out caroling as part of the Brindlewood Bay Lunch Club’s annual Ugly Christmas Sweater Carol-a-thon fundraiser. Go around the table and ask each player to describe their Maven’s ugly Christmas sweater.

boardgame.name: The GBBBO (The Great Brindlewood Bay Bake-Off)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The most popular television program in the world, The Jolly Good Baking Show, has come to Brindlewood Bay to find the town’s very best baker. A number of qualifying rounds have been held, and our Murder Mavens are among the bakers to make it through to the final, televised portion of the show, where they will meet the charming presenters and have their confections judged by the notoriously strict Paul and Jane.

boardgame.name: L'énigmatique carnet du capitaine Pop Plinn
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Les bois qui abritent aujourd'hui Palmpont ont blen du mal à nous donner une idée de ce qu'éntait Brocéliande. La forêt mythique qui s'étendait sans soute jadis jusqu'à Rennes, s'est peu à peu réduite à une peau de chagrin.

boardgame.name: Le dompteur de Volcans
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Le fakir Birman, que les joueurs vont rencontrer au cours de cette aventure, n'est pas un personnage imaginaire, il a véritablement existé, mais c'est en 1932 et non pas en 1904 qu'il commença à utiliser ses talents.

boardgame.name: Veiled Fate
boardgame.description:
Play as a divine being who has sired a demigod in the realm of humankind. The identity of your lineage is known only to you. Use positional play to complete quests—and influence fate to ensure the outcome is in your favor. Strike the perfect balance of misdirection and mischief to capture the throne.

There are 9 Demigods. At the beginning of the game, each player is secretly assigned one Demigod as their offspring. When the game begins, however, players may control the actions of any Demigod, not just their own. Through strategic play, special powers, and secret voting, players must aid their Demigod in gaining Renown. But be careful! Giving away your lineage too soon may cause the other players to work together toward your Demigod’s demise.

On their turn, players will have 2 actions with which to send Demigods on quests. Each Quest can result in 2 different ways, which the gods influence with secret voting cards called Fate Cards. When a Quest is completed, the Fate cards are revealed and the winning side of the card is resolved, giving some Demigods Renown and taking it from others. A player wins if their Demigod has the most Renown at the end of 3 rounds called ages, and that Demigod becomes the heir to the throne.

Part social deduction, part strategy, Veiled Fate pits wit against wit. Every move is a new clue to discovering the true lineage of your opponents. Can you foil carefully laid plans, while cementing your own path to victory?

-description from designer
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 66: Castell, Cat Lady, Ticket To Ride
MeepleCore Podcast Episode 105 - Ulm, Tapestry, Veiled Fate, over 30 games we are excited that are releasing soon, and much more!

boardgame.name: Enchères sous Pavillon noir
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Dans le scénario, les personnages se trouveront à plusieurs reprises mêlés au milieu vaudou de la Guadeloupe. Ils iront même jusqu'à participer à l'une de ses cérémonies et la sorcière Mama Tas de Fer n'aura de cesse de les persécuter, tout au long de cette aventure en employant zombies et sortilèges. Mais peut-on encore appeler sorcière un personnage comme Mama?

boardgame.name: La musique adoucit les meurtres
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

"Quand je veux tuer, je tue, cela même m'arrive souvent, et personne ne m'en empêche. Les lois humaines me poursuivent encore de leur vengeance, mais ma conscience ne me fait aucun reproche."

- Maldoror, Chant Quatrième


Où les membres du Club Pythagore vont faire la connaissance du "petit frère" de Fantômas qui, comme son aîné est: "Toujours quelqu'un, parfois deux personnes, jamais lui-même."

boardgame.name: Le montreur d'ombres
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

"Qu'en dira-t-elle? Que dira cette Conscience affreuse. Ce spectre qui marche dans mon chermin?"


- Chamberlayne-Pharronida

boardgame.name: Folies viennoises
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

- La valse est un rythme à trois temps: deux temps faibles, le troisième légèrement et presque douloureusement accentué. C'est exactement le rythme d'un cœur malade. Sous l'emprise d'une intense fayeur, toutefois les battements du cœur s'accélèrent, et le rythme se fait plus régulier.

Avez-vous remarqué que ces derniers temps, a Vienne, la polka rapide a presque détrôné la valse?

- A vous entendre, Herr Doktor, la terreur serait un état normal?

- Peut-être bien, Herr Kommissar, peut-être bien...

boardgame.name: Cœur Cruel
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Où la lecture d'une simple lettre vous transporte à des centaines de kilomètres de chez vous.
Où une main mystérieuse s'acharne sur les vestiges du passé.
Où les vases laissent échapper d'incompréhensibles messages.
Où après bientôt 700 ans, l'ombre du Baron plane encore sur le Béarn.
Où encore et toujours l'amour et la mort se retrouvent unis par les liens de sang.
Où la vie même devient insupportable.
Où les destins se fondent, pour le meilleur ou pour le pire ?
Où finalement non, vous ne riez pas de ne plus vous voir dans ce miroir...

boardgame.name: Tom Clancy's The Division - Espansion III: Last Stand
Tom Clancy's The Division - Last Stand
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Third expansion for Tom Clancy's The Division

boardgame.name: Danse macabre
boardgame.description:
User summary:

After a dinner and spiritualism session the PCs are returning home when they witness a burglary and murder at the Cluny Museum.

They will have to unravel this strange affair, punctuated by the strange music of Camille Saint-Saëns, where modernity and the Middle Ages, life and death, mingle.

boardgame.name: La cornemuse du vieux Jeremiah
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Cette aventure va conduire un petit groupe de personnages français à se rendre dans la région des Highlands d'Ecosse.

L'un d'entre eux est un descendant direct des Saint-Simon, une famille aristocratique écossaise réfugiée en France avec la cour des Stuart après la cuisante défaite des Jacobites à la bataille de Culloden en 1746.

L'histoire va commencer lorsqu'un messager vient apporter un testament de Lord William Saint-Simon, comte d'Abersheen et de Blackburn, décédé depuis peu, à l'héritier de la branche française de sa famille.

A partir de cet instant commencera un enchaînement d'événements et de mystères à découvrir et à résoudre, une malédiction familiale, des cadavres mutilés, une étrange hindoue et... la complainte douloureuse d'une cornemuse sur la lande déserte...

boardgame.name: Totally Accurate Battlegrounds
boardgame.description:
Totally Accurate Battlegrounds is a parody of the Battle Royale genre. A bunch of physics-based weirdos fight it out on an island, everything is silly and possibly a bit buggy.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Dzieciaki na miotłach
Kids on Brooms
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

You pull your wand from the folds of your cloak, and its glowing blue end illuminates the door in front of you—the entrance to the banned books section. You watch as the copper snakes twist and turn around the lock that keeps students like you out. But you’ve been left with no choice. Your barn owl hoots softly upon your shoulder as you raise your wand to the knob and whisper the unspoken words.

Kids on Brooms is a collaborative role-playing game about taking on the life of a witch or wizard at a magical school you all attend- a place full of mystery, danger, and thrilling adventure. From dealing with strict professors to facing down mythical beasts, players will get the opportunity to ride brooms, brew potions, and cast powerful magic as they uncover the incredible secrets their school and its inhabitants hold.

boardgame.name: Train Sim World
Train Sim World 2020
boardgame.description:
Train Sim World 2020 is an immersive first-person simulator perfect for everyone, with complete in-cab interactivity, detailed accurate locos, real-world routes and hours of gameplay. Start your journey…

Available now on Steam, PlayStation 4 and Xbox One Train Sim World 2020 includes authentic routes from the UK, Germany and the US, and adds new features designed for both beginners and experienced players. Here’s what you’ll find inside…

Master the rails
Train Sim World caters to players of all ability levels, featuring guided tutorials that cover everything you need to operate the locomotives and become a master of the rails. Climb into the cab and learn to operate a range of locos step-by-step, quickly moving from novice to expert.

Authenticity
At Dovetail Games we strive for absolute authenticity – Everything in Train Sim World is based as closely as possible on the real world, from the controls and physics of the locomotives to the stations and landmarks.

Start a new journey
The new Journey system in Train Sim World 2020 blends together more than 24 hours of curated gameplay. Combining tutorials, scenarios and timetabled services, this will help guide you from mission to mission so you can build up your skills. Journeys are available on: Great Western Express, Long Island Rail Road, Main Spessart Bahn, Northern Trans-Pennine and Peninsula Corridor!

All aboard
Enjoy a host of new features focusing on the player experience with our free update. New features in Train Sim World 2020 include: Intuitive tutorials, a new Action Point system that rewards accuracy, route progress tracker and detailed debrief results screen. All to help you become a master of the rails.

Peninsula Corridor
Explore the brand new Peninsula Corridor route, putting you in the cab of Caltrain services stretching from San Francisco to San Jose with authentic freight and passenger operations. Available as part of the Digital Deluxe Edition or to purchase separately.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Train Sim World 2
boardgame.description:
Master iconic locomotives on high-speed services, long freight hauls or precise commuter traffic, and get creative with customisation tools in this advanced sequel. Climb into the cab in Train Sim World 2.

AUTHENTICALLY REPLICATED ROUTES AND LOCOS
Feel the thrill of high-speed inter-city German rail as you push the throttle and climb speeds in the famous DB ICE 3M out of Köln, take on the challenge of hauling long freight across Sand Patch Grade with the CSX AC4400CW, and master the complex operations of the London Underground on the Bakerloo Line. All official licenses, all authentically recreated – you're in the cab and in control.

GET CREATIVE
Personalise your rail journey with two brand new easy-to-use tools. Create your own custom liveries with the Livery Designer that allows you to craft both simple and complex designs to bring your Train Sim World 2 loco liveries to life. Create your own scenario with the Scenario Planner, picking locos and destinations before you jump in and take to the rails - Quick drive, your way.

EXPERIENCE A NEW LEVEL OF REALISM
The proprietary SimuGraph® vehicle dynamics engine has evolved – adding realistic adhesion physics for the first time. Feel the slip of wheels in adverse weather, master moving heavy freight and keep control of your loco power on steep inclines! Optimised and upgraded visual fidelity also gives Train Sim World 2 dynamic skies and 4K support.

IMMERSE YOURSELF IN SIMULATION
Get clearer information on instructions, gradient and speed profiles as you drive, including new HUD displays, clarity to the onboard safety systems, brake controls, power meter and accelerometer. A new controller scheme will give great choices on Camera and Driving modes and allows easier access from external camera mode to enter another vehicle in your consist, all while full physics and simulation are still running.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Tapestry: Manœuvres et Manigances
Tapestry: Pläne und Gegenpläne
Tapestry: Planes y Complots
Tapestry: Plannen en Complotten

boardgame.description:

boardgame.name: Fortune of the Forgotten World
boardgame.description:
Welcome to FORTUNE OF THE FORGOTTEN WORLD. In the future, genetic engineering has made possible the return of dinosaurs to planet Earth. Meanwhile, entertainment demands are at an all-time high.

A child of these strange times, FORTUNE OF THE FORGOTTEN WORLD is the highest rated show in history. Located on Island 17A, a scientific experiment gone awry, the television show offers contestants a chance to find a veritable fortune in cash that is stashed on the island, locate the hidden raft and escape to safety, all the while fighting and running from dinosaurs, collecting useful items, fending off other contestants, and competing for the best ratings with the television audience.

YOU are one of this season’s contestants, having survived a rigorous screening process that includes a paleontologist, an engineer, a soldier, a trail guide, a cook, a medical doctor, a professional athlete, and a popular celebrity. Can you outwit the competition, survive combat with history’s deadliest predators, puzzle out the island’s technology all to recover the hidden stash of cash and escape with your life?

Gameplay involves players "landing" on the island by placing their tokens on the hex board, and then rolling dice to move around, revealing tiles that they encounter along the way. Tiles might be useful items such as weapons, health packs, or tools -- or they could be wild dinosaurs which force players to evade or battle them. Only one tile is the sought-after prize money. Once the money is found, players must race to find the raft off of the island, which may lie beyond gates that must be powered on and unlocked. Will you prepare a route to safety before you search for the prize money? Establish choke points to steal the money from other players? Scour the island for the prize money in hopes that you don't encounter a deadly dinosaur instead? Your decisions affect how the TV audience perceives you. Unpopular players may get "fired", while popular ones will be rewarded by studio executives. Random events may interfere with your strategy, so always have a contingency plan and don't forget about your character's unique skills!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Zoo Tac Toe
boardgame.description:
The board represents a zoo with unique 36 animals. Players must get animals to escape from the zoo by matching animals with attributes on cards. When matched, an animal tile is flipped to reveal an arrow. Align the arrow to point to the player.

Once three or more adjacent arrows or a square point to a player, that player's animals "escape". The player collects a coin matching the number of animals released and those tiles are replaced with new animals. It is possible to collect two coins when two lines are made by intersection.

Once all attribute cards have been played, the player with the most coin values is the winner. In case of a tie, continue with ten more attribute cards.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: A Sword Turned Inward: Part Three of the Red Deer Saga
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The clan has a number of holy places within Red Deer and the wider tula, the majority of these are shrines and sites, but they do maintain some temples; Shrines tend to fall into two types; public and personal (bloodline or family).

Public shrines are places where the community is drawn together, they provide certain rune spells to the faithful and allow the devoted to regain rune points.

Family or bloodline shrines, tend to be small personal shrines for private observations.
